answer:
December is a busy month to get movies out. 

MPAA Rating trends show potentially more movies made for people under 13 than over 13. 

A majority of movies are between 80-140 minutes long.  People probably feel they don't get value out of a movie if it's too short. 

A majority of US DVD sales come from original screenplay and movies based on books/graphic novels. 

There are very few worldwide successful films based on toys or musical groups.
